title: Removes the Niagara section of the thruway from the control of the thruway authority and puts it under the department of transportation's control; repealer
summary: Removes the Niagara section of the thruway from the control of the thruway authority and puts it under the department of transportation's control.

       Introduced  by  Sen. MAZIARZ -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the public authorities  law  and  the  highway  law,  in
         relation to removing the Niagara section of the New York state thruway
         from  the  control of the thruway authority and to putting the Niagara
         section of the New York state thruway under the control of the depart-
         ment of transportation; and to repeal certain provisions of the public
         authorities law and the highway law relating thereto

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Subdivision 8 of section 356 of the public authorities law
    2  is REPEALED and subdivision 9 is renumbered subdivision 8.
    3    S 2. Subdivision 4 of section 356-a of the public authorities  law  is
    4  REPEALED and subdivision 5, as added by chapter 741 of the laws of 1957,
    5  is amended to read as follows:
    6    [5]  4.  The thruway constructed along the route described in subdivi-
    7  sion [nine] EIGHT of section three hundred  fifty-six  of  this  article
    8  shall be known as "The Algonquin Path".
    9    S 3. Subdivision 6 of section 349-a of the highway law is REPEALED and
   10  subdivisions 7, 8 and 9 are renumbered subdivisions 6, 7 and 8.
   11    S  4. The highway law is amended by adding a new section 341-b to read

   13    S 341-B. ACCEPTANCE OF A BRIDGE AND HIGHWAY AS PART OF THE STATE HIGH-

   20  TERLY DIRECTION TO THE FRONT, THENCE THROUGH THE FRONT AND NORTH BETWEEN

    1  NIAGARA STREET AND THE SHIP CANAL TO THE RIGHT OF WAY OF  THE  ABANDONED
    2  ERIE  CANAL  NEAR  THE NORTHERN END OF SUCH SHIP CANAL, THENCE GENERALLY
    3  ALONG SUCH RIGHT OF WAY, DEVIATING THEREFROM TO MAKE A  CONNECTION  WITH
    4  THE  EASTERLY  APPROACH  OF THE SOUTH GRAND ISLAND BRIDGE, THENCE ACROSS
    5  THE NIAGARA RIVER, UTILIZING THE EXISTING  SOUTH  GRAND  ISLAND,  THENCE
    6  ALONG OR PARALLEL TO EXISTING GRAND ISLAND BOULEVARD, ACROSS THE NIAGARA
    7  RIVER,  UTILIZING THE EXISTING NORTH GRAND ISLAND BRIDGE AND SUCH BRIDGE
    8  AND HIGHWAY SHALL HEREAFTER BE A PART OF SUCH  SYSTEM,  SUBJECT  TO  THE
    9  SUPERVISION  AND  CONTROL  OF THE COMMISSIONER OF TRANSPORTATION, AND BE
   10  HEREAFTER MAINTAINED, REPAIRED OR RECONSTRUCTED SOLELY AT THE EXPENSE OF
   11  THE STATE, NOTWITHSTANDING THE PROVISIONS OF ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW.
   12    THE AFORESAID HIGHWAY SHALL BE UNDER THE JURISDICTION OF  THE  COMMIS-
   13  SIONER OF TRANSPORTATION AND IN ANY FUTURE IMPROVEMENT SHALL BE ELIGIBLE
   14  FOR FEDERAL AID IN THE SAME MANNER AS ANY OTHER STATE HIGHWAY OR BRIDGE.
   15    S 5. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   16  it shall have become a law; provided, however, that effective immediate-
   17  ly,  the  addition,  amendment  and/or  repeal of any rule or regulation
   18  necessary for the implementation of this act on its effective  date  are
   19  authorized and directed to be made and completed on or before such date.
